title: Constant Speed formula
body: Where \(d\) is distance, \(v\) is velocity and \(t\) is time

title: Pythagorean theorem
body: Where \(c\) is the hypotenuse.

title: Constant acceleration (velocity)
body: Where \(v\) is the final speed, \(v_0\) is the initial speed.

title: Constant acceleration (displacement)
body: Where \(v_0\) is the initial speed.

title: Newton's second law
body: Where \(F\) is force.

title: Force of Friction
body: Where \(\mu\) is the friction coefficient, \(F_n\) is the normal force.

title: Newton's law of universal gravitation
body: Where \(G\) is \(6,674 \cdot 10^{-11} Nm^2 /kg^2\), and \(r\) is distance between the two masses.

title: Work
body: Where \(F\) is the force in the direction of movement.

title: Work during acceleration
body: Where \(W\) is the work done during acceleration.

title: Potential Energy
body: Where \(E_p\) is the potential energy at height \(h\)

title: Kinetic Energy
body: Kinetic energy of object during motion.

title: Potential Energy of a Spring
body: Where \(\Delta l\) is the elongation of the spring from natural state, and \(k\) the spring constant.

title: Total Energy in a Spring
body: Where \(k\) is the spring constant, and \(A\) the amplitude of the spring.

title: Efficiency
body: Where \(\eta\) is the efficiency.

title: Hooke's law
body: Where \(\Delta l\) is the elongation of the spring, and \(k\) the spring constant

title: Projectile Motion (Velocity in x)
body: Where \(v_0\) is the initial velocity, \(a\) is the angle relative to the ground.

title: Projectile Motion (Velocity in y)
body: Where \(v_0\) is the initial velocity, \(a\) is the angle relative to the ground.

title: Projectile Motion (Displacement in x)
body: Where \(x\) is the displacement at time \(t\)

title: Projectile Motion (Displacement in y)
body: Where \(v_0\) is the initial velocity, \(a\) is the angle relative to the ground.

title: Maximum Height of a Projectile Motion
Uniform Circular Motion (Angle Velocity)
body: Where \(\omega\) is the angle velocity, and T is the period time.

title: Uniform Circular Motion (Centripetal Acceleration)
body: Where \(a_c\) is the Centripetal Acceleration.

title: Uniform Circular Motion (Centripetal Force)
body: Where \(F_c\) is the Centripetal Force.

title: Momentum
body: Where \(p\) is the momentum.

title: Conservation of momentum
formula: \[m \cdot v_0 + m' \cdot v_0' = m \cdot v + m' \cdot v'\]
body: Where \(m\) and \(v'\) is the mass and velocity of the second object.

title: Elastic Collision Formula
body: Where \(v'\) is the velocity of the second object.

title: Impulse
body: Impulse \(I\) is force applied during a certain amount of time.

title: Ohm's Law
body: Where V is Voltage, R is Resistance and I is Current.

title: Equivalent Resistance in Parallel
body: Denominator can be expanded for more resistors.

title: Current Divider
body: where \(I_X\) is the current through resistor, \(R_X\) is the resistance of the resistor, \(R_T\) the other resistance, and \(I_T\) the total current when entering the combined network of resistors.

title: Coulumb's Law
body: Where k is the Coulomb constant, or \(\frac{1}{4\pi \epsilon_0}\), or \(8.99 \cdot 10^9 Nm^2/C^2\)

title: Gauss Law
body: Where \(dA\) is the gaussian surface enclosing the sphere. \(k = \frac{1}{4\pi\epsilon_0}\)

title: Impedance
formula: \[Z_R = R \quad Z_L = j\omega L \quad Z_C = 1/j\omega C \quad V = IZ\]
body: Where \(Z_R\) is for Resistor, \(Z_L\) for Inductors, and \(Z_C\) for Capacitors. \(L\) is Inductance in Henry, and \(C\) is Capacitance in Fahrad. \(\omega\) is the angular frequency

title: RMS or Effective values in AC
Power in AC Circuits
body: Where \(P\) is the real power, \(R\) is the reactive power, \(S\) is the complex power, \(|S|\) is the apprent power and \(\theta\) is the angle between Voltage and Current.
